TopicTitle: How To Get Into Orbit | Begginers

Articles.Content:
This tutorial is nothing special this is just the way I do it.

Rocket Design

Mk16 parachute

Mk1 command pod

TT-18A stack decoupler

FL-T600 fuel tank

LV-909 "Terrier" liquid fuel engine

TT-18A stack decoupler

FL-T 800 fuel tank

LV-T30 "Swivel" liquid fuel engine      RT-10 "Hammer" solid rocket booster x2

 

Tutoial

Make sure your Solid rocket boosters's go of at the same time as the liquid fuel engine put your throttle 2/3 and liftoff! Make sure when you reach 145 m/s you turn to the little 80 on the NavBall. Now when you reach 300 ,m/s turn to the 60 on the NavBall. Decouple. Now go into map view [M] and hover over the blue Ap wait until the number on it says around 75,000 and cut off your engines, next go back to fly view [M] and turn to the line between the orange and blue and throttle 1/3 and go back into map view and look at the blue line widen a bit (for about 15 seconds). Cut of throttle. now click on the Ap sign and press the Manuever thing. Now click and move your mouse up (still clicking) on the  until you get about a perfect circle of the orange dotted lines. Go into fly view and toggle SAS on [T] if you haven't already and click on the  in the red circle around the NavBall. You should see some green letters on the right of the NavBall that say Est. Burn and Node in T- look at the Est. Burn number lets say its 1m 30s whats half of that? 45s put on full throttle when it says Node in T-45s and burn full throttle until the Est. burn says 1 and cut-off your engines and above the Node in T+ and Est. Burn there should be a green tick and click on it. You are now in orbit!
Thank you so much! Just what i was looking for!
